Perturbation Class Reference
Free Energy Perturbation

Detailed Description

Model of parameter dependence in a free energy perturbation theory.

A Perturbation object defines a parameter dependent statistical weight of the type used in free energy perturbation theory, replica exchange, and extended ensemble algorithms. In all of these applications, the probability of a microstate X is given by an exponential exp(-W(X,p)), where W(X,p) = beta*H depends upon a perturbation parameter p, H is the system Hamiltonian and beta = 1/kT is inverse temperature. Either the Hamiltonian or the inverse temperature may depend upon the perturbation parameter.

This class provides a method to modify the system parameters (beta and/or the potential energy parameters) so as to correspond to a given value of p, and methods to evaluate the derivative dW(X,p)/dp and difference W(X, p') - W(X, p) for a given system configuration.

void setParameter ( DArray< double >  parameter)

Sets the perturbation parameter value.

This method sets the value of the member parameter, and calls the virtual void setParameter() method to modify the parameter of the associated System.

virtual double parameter ( int  i) const [pure virtual]

Gets the perturbation parameter p[i] of index i associated with this system.

Returns the value of the perturbation parameter p[i].

Implemented in McEnergyPerturbation, McExternalPerturbation< Interaction >, McPairExternalPerturbation< PairInteraction, ExternalInteraction >, and McPairPerturbation< Interaction >.

virtual double derivative ( int  i) const [pure virtual]

Get derivative of the Boltzmann weight W(X,p) with respect to the perturbation parameter p[i] of index i.

For a system in which W(X,p) = beta*H depends on a microstate X and a parameter p, this method returns the value of dW(X, p)/dp[i] for the current system microstate (i.e., for the current particle positions).

Implemented in McEnergyPerturbation, McExternalPerturbation< Interaction >, McPairExternalPerturbation< PairInteraction, ExternalInteraction >, and McPairPerturbation< Interaction >.

virtual double difference ( DArray< double >  iPartnerParameter) const [pure virtual]

Returns the difference W(X, p') - W(X, p).

This method returns the difference W(X, p') - W(X, p) between value of the statistical weight W(X,p[i]) = H/kT for the current microstate, where p[i] is the value of the perturbation parameter in this system, and p'[i] = iPartnerParameter is the partner perturbation parameter value that is passed to this function.

Parameters:
iPartnerParameterperturbation parameters for partner system.

Implemented in LinearPerturbation< SystemType >, and LinearPerturbation< McSystem >.

virtual void setParameter ( ) [protected, pure virtual]

Sets the perturbation parameter in the associated system.

This method modifies the parameters of the associated System so as to correspond to the value of the parameter member variable.

Implemented in McEnergyPerturbation, McExternalPerturbation< Interaction >, McPairExternalPerturbation< PairInteraction, ExternalInteraction >, and McPairPerturbation< Interaction >.

Referenced by Perturbation::readParameters(), and Perturbation::setParameter().
